dmca.title: Re: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of WESTERN UNION(r) Marks
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: abuseadm@theplanet.com [mailto:abuseadm@theplanet.com] On Behalf
Of The Planet Policy Enforcement
Posted At: Thursday, June 15, 2006 3:35 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of WESTERN UNION(r) Marks
(2.23.113)
Subject: Re: [ABUSE] Unauthorized Use of WESTERN UNION(r) Marks
(2.23.113)


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Your email is being forwarded on to our Copyright counsel for review, at
the address of copyright@theplanet.com.

- --
Thanks,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html


BrandProtection@firstdata.com wrote:
> * *
> 
> * WESTERN UNION HOLDINGS, INC. *
> 
> * 6200 So. Quebec Street, *
> 
> * Greenwood Village, CO. 80111 U.S.A *
> 
> * *
> 
> 
> 06/15/2006
>  
> VIA E-MAIL at  abuse@theplanet.com
>  
> ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
> 1333 North Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110 Dallas TX, 75207
> 
> *Re:* *Unauthorized Use of the WESTERN UNION*^  * Marks in the Meta 
> Tags on 
> http://www.casinos-com.com/free-no-deposit-bonus-online-casinos.htm *
> 
>  To Whom It May Concern:
> 
> 
> This notification and request concern use of the WESTERN UNION service

> marks in the Meta Tags on the website at 
> *http://www.casinos-com.com/free-no-deposit-bonus-online-casinos.htm*,
> for which you are listed as registrant and/or administrative contact.
> 
>  Western Union Holdings, Inc. ("Western Union") owns all intellectual 
> property rights in the famous WESTERN UNION family of trademarks and 
> service marks (the "WESTERN UNION Marks"), which include the words 
> "WESTERN UNION" and/or the initials "WU" standing alone, as well as 
> the WESTERN UNION ?? design and Western Union?s golden yellow and 
> black trade dress. The WESTERN UNION Marks, which have been in use in 
> some instances since 1851, are famous throughout the world in 
> connection with numerous and varied communication and financial 
> services. Worldwide, Western Union owns over 720 registrations for 
> WESTERN UNION Marks and over 150 pending applications for WESTERN 
> UNION Marks. Through Western Union?s long-standing use and promotion 
> of the WESTERN UNION Marks in international commerce, the Marks have
acquired great value and goodwill.
>  
> It has been brought to Western Union?s attention that the WESTERN 
> UNION Marks are being used in the meta tags on the website located at 
> http://www.casinos-com.com/free-no-deposit-bonus-online-casinos.htm.
> Western Union is concerned that this unauthorized use of the WESTERN 
> UNION Marks will confuse consumers as to whether Western Union somehow

> is associated with, or approves of,  
> http://www.casinos-com.com/free-no-deposit-bonus-online-casinos.htm 
> **and/or the activities conducted through
>  
> *http://www.casinos-com.com/free-no-deposit-bonus-online-casinos.htm.*
> Further, Western Union is concerned that such authorized use of its 
> Marks may dilute their distinctiveness and Western Union?s good will.
>  
> * Western Union understands that you may not previously have been 
> aware that such use of the WESTERN UNION Marks is not authorized and 
> that it may violate U.S. and international trademark laws. 
> Accordingly, this letter is formal notification that Western Union 
> cannot permit such unauthorized use of the WESTERN UNION Marks and a 
> formal request that such use immediately cease *.
>  
> Please ensure that the WESTERN UNION Marks immediately are removed 
> from the website and/or meta tags  at 
> *http://www.casinos-com.com/free-no-deposit-bonus-online-casinos.htm*;
> that any print, electronic, and other forms of promotional materials 
> containing any form of the WESTERN UNION Marks and/or marks 
> confusingly similar to the WESTERN UNION Marks (including uses in 
> metatags, hidden text, keywords or other "ad triggers," postURL or 
> forwarding commands, hyperlinks, or any other electronic coding) are 
> withdrawn from publication; and that you  refrain from further use of 
> any form of the WESTERN UNION Marks and/or marks confusingly similar 
> thereto. We stress that the WESTERN UNION Marks include the words 
> "WESTERN UNION" and/or the initials "WU" alone, the WESTERN UNION 
> double-bar logo, and the distinctive WESTERN UNION golden yellow and 
> black trade dress ? and any marks or names confusingly similar 
> thereto, including variants, abbreviations, and misspellings of the
words "WESTERN UNION."
>  
> We look forward  to receiving your written response to our 
> notification and request. Please do not hesitate to contact us with 
> you further questions or concerns.
>  
> This notification and request do not prejudice Western Union's rights 
> and remedies related to this matter, which hereby are expressly
reserved.
>  
> Sincerely,
> Western Union Holdings, Inc.- Intellectual Property Group 12500 
> Belford Ave. M21A2 Englewood, Colorado 80112 Fax # 720-332-0518
>  
> 
> This email is sent by the General Counsel's Office of First Data
> Corporation and may contain information that is privileged and/or
> confidential. If you are not the intended recipient, please notify the
> sender immediately and delete this e-mail and any attachments. Thank
you
>  
>  
> 
> 
> 
>  
>  
>  
>  
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
>  
>  
>  
>  
>
